other_tests.findings: Pathological examination of the biopsy specimen revealed evidence of a CD30+ lymphoproliferative disorder consistent with ALK-negative ALCL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: New lesions appeared 2 months after completion of chemotherapy, with subsequent biopsies reporting evidence of recurrent ALCL.

other_tests.findings: Pathological examination of the new lesions revealed evidence of recurrent ALCL.
The inguinal lymph nodes had decreased in size; the largest node was 2.0 cm by 0.6 cm and no longer showed increased FDG avidity.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The largest lymph node had decreased from 4.1 cm by 2.4 cm to 2.0 cm by 0.6 cm.
